channel.title: Tools for Academic Research
channel.description: Recent content on Tools for Academic Research

item.title: PPResume
item.description: A LaTeX Based Resume Builder that helps people create beautifully typed resumes in minutes

item.title: White Noise Generator
item.description: This is a completely free web application aimed at a wide range of industry users, aiming to provide high-quality customized white noise experience for every user.

item.title: SimilarStudies
item.description: Discover Related Medical Research Literature Instantly with Similar Studies.

item.title: ASReview
item.description: Active learning tool designed to aid researchers in the title/abstract screening step of systematic reviews. It is expected to save time as it allows a prioritized screening based on prior knowledge (set of at least one relevant and one irrelevant record).

item.title: ResearchMate.pro
item.description: Instantly Extract Insights from Medical Research Papers with ResearchMate.

item.title: Enago Read
item.description: Enago Read is an AI assistant that speeds up the literature review process, offering summaries and key insights to save researchers reading time. It boosts productivity with advanced AI technology and the Copilot feature, enabling real-time questions for deeper comprehension of extensive literature. (It was called RAx.)

item.title: StArt
item.description: StArt is a tool developed in an academic environment with scientific soundness that supports conducting systematic reviews.

item.title: Trinka AI
item.description: Trinka is an AI-powered English grammar checker and language enhancement writing assistant designed for academic and technical writing. Trinka corrects contextual spelling mistakes and advanced grammar errors by providing writing suggestions in real-time. It helps professionals and academics ensure formal, concise, and engaging writing. Trinka’s Enterprise solutions come with unlimited access and great customization options to all of Trinkaâ€™s powerful capabilities.

item.title: FocusTube
item.description: Find Best Work & Study BGM ðŸŽ§ Welcome to FocusTube - the go-to platform for sharing YouTube videos perfect for focused activities. Discover a diverse range of genres, including lo-fi hip hop, electronica, jazz, and ambient sounds such as cafe noise or rain sounds. Anyone can submit their favorites, making our collection constantly growing and ever-changing.

item.title: myNoise
item.description: Discover a world of immersive and customizable soundscapes that can enhance focus, relaxation, and sleep. Choose from noise generators, nature sounds and ambient music to create your perfect audio environment. Explore our vast library of interactive sound generators and find your audio haven!

item.title: Perplexity AI
item.description: Perplexity is your AI-powered Swiss Army Knife for information discovery and curiosity. It’s not just about answering questions; it’s about empowering you to do moreâ€”whether you’re looking to summarize content, explore new topics, or even get a little creative.

item.title: Cosma
item.description: Cosma is a document graph visualization tool. It modelizes interlinked Markdown files and renders them as an interactive network in a web interface. You can use Cosma to create a portable knowledge base, combining rich hypertextual descriptions with the affordances of a graph view, contextualized backlinks, automatically generated citations, metadata filters and more.

item.title: Typst
item.description: Typst is a new markup-based typesetting system for the sciences. It is designed to be an alternative both to advanced tools like LaTeX and simpler tools like Word and Google Docs. Our goal with Typst is to build a typesetting tool that is highly capable and a pleasure to use.

item.title: Xbase
item.description: It’s a Twitter Bookmark Manager for professional users.

item.title: Inciteful
item.description: Find the most relevant literature using graphs and metrics.

item.title: Expontum
item.description: Expontum (https://www.expontum.com/) - Helps researchers quickly find knowledge gaps and identify what research projects have been completed before.

item.title: DeepL Write
item.description: DeepL Write is an AI writing tool that can improve your written communication with just one click. It will help you with your writing by checking the grammar, punctuation, and style as well as providing suggestions and alternative phrasing.

item.title: Synthical for Researchers
item.description: Discover, learn, and share research, made easy with our AI.

item.title: Playground AI
item.description: Generate images for your presentations

item.title: Adobe Firefly
item.description: Experiment, imagine, and create an infinite range of images with Firefly, generative AI-powered content creation from Adobe.

item.title: Microsoft Bing Image Generator
item.description: Generate images by typing some texts.

item.title: Replicate
item.description: Run and share models in the cloud at scale.

item.title: Sciencecast
item.description: ScienceCast is a free open-access platform for researchers to disseminate their scientific results and ideas to a wide audience of fellow scientists, journal Editors, grant program managers, and other professionals working at the cutting edge of science and innovation.

item.title: Influence Map
item.description: Influence flower visualizes citation influences among academic entities, including papers, authors, institutions, and research topics.

item.title: Scholarcy
item.description: The AI-powered article summarizer

item.title: QuillBot
item.description: Toolbox for academic reading and writing

item.title: SciSpace
item.description: Search the largest scientific corpus in the world. Discover and study research papers better with SciSpace copilot

item.title: Scite Assistant
item.description: Assistant is a conversational tool made by scite that lets you ask questions in simple language and get answers backed by real, up to date references. Think of like ChatGPT with real, up to date references, tailor-made for anyone discovering, understanding, or writing research.

item.title: Prompt Engineering Guide
item.description: Guides on prompt engineering to get the best out of the Large Language Models.

item.title: A.R.I.A. (Aria)
item.description: Aria is Your AI Research Assistant Powered by Large Language Models

item.title: ChatGPT
item.description: A model called ChatGPT which interacts in a conversational way. The dialogue format makes it possible for ChatGPT to answer follow-up questions, admit its mistakes, challenge incorrect premises, and reject inappropriate requests.

item.title: Bordio
item.description: Bordio is a productivity platform for organizing all your tasks, events, and projects in one single place.

item.title: doi2bib
item.description: To retrieve BibTeX entries by inserting DOI into a web system that will return the BibTeX entry corresponding to the document/record.

item.title: MyLabBook
item.description: An open source research platform or ELN based on WordPress and the FAIR Data Toolkit that is Sustainable, Affordable, FAIR, and Easy.

item.title: dimensions.ai
item.description: With Dimensions, you have free access to a vast collection of curated research outputs and tools that help you source exactly what you need to advance your own discoveries.

item.title: Curvenote
item.description: A beautiful writing tool designed for technical writing, connected to Jupyter.

item.title: Heptabase
item.description: visual networked and mind-mapping note taking app

item.title: Scrintal
item.description: visual networked and mind-mapping note taking app

item.title: PaperDigest
item.description: Sci-Tech knowledge graph & text analysis platform for scientific literature tracking, summarization and search

item.title: Papers with Code
item.description: The mission of Papers with Code is to create a free and open resource with Machine Learning papers, code, datasets, methods and evaluation tables. There is also papers with code for physics, astronomy, and more.

item.title: Dendron
item.description: Opensource knowledge management inside your vscode editor, with linked notes, and tools for publishing notes.

item.title: Logseq
item.description: Logseq is a joyful, open-source outliner that works on top of local plain-text Markdown and Org-mode files. Use it to write, organize and share your thoughts, keep your to-do list, and build your own digital garden.

item.title: Elicit
item.description: Elicit is a GPT-3 powered research assistant.

item.title: Kroki
item.description: Creates diagrams from textual descriptions

item.title: Hyperdraft
item.description: Create a static website by typing plaintext or Markdown.

item.title: Cassyni
item.description: Discover, watch, run, publish and cite online academic seminars. Share research in a way that is impactful, green and inclusive.

item.title: ReadPaper
item.description: A Chinese website for reading, managing, and discussing research papers online.

item.title: Research Rabbit
item.description: Discover and track literature

item.title: PaperPanda
item.description: PaperPanda is a chrome extension to access the PDF files of research papers by automatically searching the web. So our research is not blocked by the paywall.

item.title: papers-with-video
item.description: A browser extension that adds video explanations to research papers on arxiv.org

item.title: PubPeer
item.description: The online journal club of research articles with comments.

item.title: Colorgorical
item.description: A categorical color generator for data visualizations. It takes into account of perceptual distance.

item.title: About Tools for Academic Research by KausalFlow
item.description: About Tools for Academic Research This website is an extension of the GitHub repo emptymalei/awesome-research. The original repo still accepts pull requests but we recommend submitting this website. The content of this website is under the CC BY-SA license. Use the source and keep the source open! How to use the data There three different ways to use the data. Use the website, tools.kausalflow.com. Use RSS feed, RSS Feed. Use feed reader to follow new contents.

item.title: ColorHunt
item.description: Color palletes with a clean UI

item.title: LaptopFriendly
item.description: Find a laptop friendly place to work

item.title: Bibcitation
item.description: Cite your sources in over 9,000 formats and generate automatic citations and works cited for books, websites and journal articles.

item.title: gatsby-digital-garden
item.description: A set of packages to create a digital garden with Gatsby.

item.title: Modern Lab Community
item.description: Community for researchers to share best practices.

item.title: Graph Suchi Yomitori System (GSYS)
item.description: A tool to extract numerical values from graphs

item.title: Colabra
item.description: Collaborative ELN and Project Management

item.title: Coolors
item.description: Nice tool to select color palette/theme for figure plotting and/or design

item.title: Artigopapers
item.description: Explore scientific, technical, and medical research on Artigo

item.title: Hypothesis
item.description: Collaborative or private note taking on the web. Highlight and annotate websites in distinct notebooks.

item.title: Gatsby knowledge base theme
item.description: Create your Second Brain by writing down your thoughts - or as the term used this theme topics - and their relations in markdown.

item.title: WebPlotDigitizer
item.description: Web based tool to extract data from plots, images, and maps

item.title: slidev
item.description: Presentation Slides for Developers

item.title: Deckset
item.description: Deckset designs your slides, so you can focus on your ideas

item.title: Fusuma
item.description: A tool to create slides easily for you, using markdown with interactions (mdx).

item.title: LearnObit
item.description: A cognitive tool to boost learning

item.title: Data Stewardship Wizard
item.description: Create Smart Data Management Plans for FAIR Open Science

item.title: Dataverse
item.description: Open source research data repository software that can be setup easily

item.title: Litmaps
item.description: Navigate the literature with interactive visualisations of citation networks and discover science faster

item.title: Paperpile
item.description: Reference manager made by scientists for scientists using modern technology

item.title: Gitmind
item.description: Free, online mindmapping and flow charts

item.title: Sighchology Research Lab | æ˜Ÿç¤¼ç ”ç©¶æ‰€
item.description: In this game, you play as a student in the Sighchology Research Lab. In this dark place, you do research every night and day without sleep, because you have been given a great mission: to publish a piece of paper.

item.title: Principia: Master of Science
item.description: Principia: Master of Science is a simulation game with the theme of European science in 17th century. Choose one of 12 real scientists from the era of Isaac Newton and proceed with your research. It is a time when even the term “Science” did not exist. Who can be the master of science?

item.title: FOAM
item.description: A personal knowledge management and sharing system for VSCode

item.title: SciWheel
item.description: Reference Manager to discover, read, annotate, write and share scientific research

item.title: Table Convert Online
item.description: Web-based tool to converts Excel, URL, HTML, Markdown table and CSV to Markdown table, CSV/TSV, JSON, XML, YAML, insert SQL, HTML, Excel and LaTeX table.

item.title: SciNote
item.description: SciNote Electronic Lab Notebook (ELN). Top-rated solution trusted by the FDA & 70k+ scientists in 100+ countries.

item.title: RSpace
item.description: The next-gen eLab notebook with free data storage and free version.

item.title: Labstep
item.description: Unify your scientific data documentation through Labstep’s all-in-one cloud solution. Connect your notebook, inventory, data collection and downstream analysis. Share your records in a secure environment.

item.title: Labii
item.description: User-friendly, fully customizable Electronic Lab Notebook and Laboratory Information Management System

item.title: The Electronic Lab Notebook in 2020: A comprehensive guide
item.description: How to choose the best ELN for your research?

item.title: Labguru
item.description: Run your lab more efficiently and maximize your research output. Plan and document experiments, track progress, streamline lab logistics, and share results.

item.title: Labfolder
item.description: A reliable infrastructure for your data

item.title: Labcollector
item.description: All-in-One Lab notebook and management platform.

item.title: Labarchives
item.description: The Leading Research Data Management Platform.

item.title: Hivebench
item.description: Everything you need to do research: Plan, Experiment, Publish.

item.title: eLabFTW
item.description: A free and open source electronic lab notebook designed by researchers, for researchers, with usability in mind.

item.title: Benchling
item.description: Electronic Lab Notebook done right. Bringing life to life science R&D by transforming your R&D with the industry’s most widely adopted Life Sciences R&D Cloud.

item.title: Endnote Click
item.description: A browser extension to read and download papers for free and legally.

item.title: Peeriodicals
item.description: Create and Edit your own journal

item.title: Deepnote
item.description: Data science notebooks for teams

item.title: Open Textbooks
item.description: Free, adaptable, openly licensed textbooks and supplemental resources.

item.title: Open Scholarship Knowledge Base
item.description: Discover open scholarship resources created and curated by the community.

item.title: Bifrost AI Datasets
item.description: Search for visual datasets by task, application, class, label or format

item.title: MyMind
item.description: MyMind is an idea note, quote, page, and image collector with the usual tag-style support. You add material from the web via a capable browser plugin; but, the standout feature is AI help in your search/retrieval of information, even without tags. It displays your saved material in a card gridâ€”think Pinterest, Pocket, and similarâ€”with selectable density and size. A large search box sits at the top with instant results while you type.

item.title: WizdomAI
item.description: Understand the journals and institutes through publications

item.title: nomnoml
item.description: a tool for drawing UML diagrams based on a simple syntax.

item.title: Conference Partner
item.description: The Latest Information Technology Conference and Journal List

item.title: ConferenceList
item.description: List of conferences in ML/AI

item.title: Writing Science
item.description: As a scientist, you are a professional writer: your career is built on successful proposals and papers. Success isn’t defined by getting papers into print, but by getting them into the reader’s consciousness. Writing Science is built upon the idea that successful science writing tells a story. It uses that insight to discuss how to write more effectively.

item.title: Academic Phrasebank
item.description: The Academic Phrasebank is a general resource for academic writers. It aims to provide you with examples of some of the phraseological â€˜nuts and boltsâ€™ of writing organised according to the main sections of a research paper or dissertation.

item.title: Scolary
item.description: Find the best scientific tools for literally any stage of your research on Scolary.

item.title: AcademicLabs
item.description: Platform where you find research groups with their current research focus, publications, patents, clinical trials and projects. Research groups can also connect with industry easily here.

item.title: Scrapbox
item.description: A knowledge base that lets you capture notes, code, and research lightning-fast. Everything adds to a web of ideas thatâ€™s easy to use at scale.

item.title: Tectonic Typesetting System
item.description: Tectonic is a modernized, complete, self-contained TeX/LaTeX engine, powered by XeTeX and TeXLive. Tectonic makes LaTeX easy to compile.

item.title: RemNote
item.description: The first spaced-repetition powered note-taking tool that lets you structure knowledge exactly in the way you think about it.

item.title: Mind the Graph
item.description: Create beautiful scientific infographics with no effort

item.title: Antidote
item.description: Writing assistant with grammar, typography and style check, dictionaries, and writing guides.

item.title: Connected Papers
item.description: Explore connected papers in a visual graph

item.title: ScholarshipDB
item.description: scholarshipdb.net is a scholarship and research job search engine. The search engine employs state of the art technologies to collect latest information from various sources and present them to you in a single website.

item.title: Biorender
item.description: a powerful tool to draw scientific illustrations

item.title: Supernotes
item.description: card based note-taking with links between cards

item.title: Responsible Journals
item.description: Understand how the journals deal with submissions and how reviews are done

item.title: RAx - Your Personal Smart Research Assistant (Rebranded to Enago Read)
item.description: (Rebranded to Enago Read) Speed up literature analysis and comprehension with RAx. Smart assistant to explore, collate insights and organize your research easily.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: note-taking with zettelkasten method (linked notes)

item.title: RoamResearch
item.description: Online note-taking with zettelkasten method (connected notes)

item.title: Notion
item.description: Write, plan, collaborate, and get organized â€” all in one tool. Write connected notes with rich format and Export to markdown, pdf, etc.

item.title: MarginNote
item.description: Efficient and visual note-taking and knowledge management while reading

item.title: Sci-Hub - Academic Papers for All
item.description: sh can helping people getting academic papers for free

item.title: Semantic Scholar
item.description: Semantic Scholar uses groundbreaking AI and engineering to understand the semantics of scientific literature to help Scholars discover relevant research.

item.title: Calendly
item.description: Calendly helps you schedule meetings without the back-and-forth emails

item.title: Doodle
item.description: It shouldnâ€™t take 30 emails to schedule a 30-minute meeting. Book meetings faster with the smart scheduling power of Doodle

item.title: SciTools
item.description: Open tools for the analysis and visualisation of Earth science data

item.title: AMiner
item.description: AI Powered Research Career: rankings of researchers, academic institutes, and conferences; trends of research topics; datasets for research.

item.title: Academic Positions
item.description: All kinds of academic jobs listings.

item.title: European Funding Guide
item.description: Find money for your education in Europe.

item.title: Whimsical
item.description: Visual workspace, online tool for quick diagrams

item.title: Mathcha
item.description: Online WYSIWYG Formula Editor . Fast and powerful Editing features, inputting Normal text, Math symbols, and drawing Graph.

item.title: Detexify
item.description: Anyone who works with LaTeX knows how time-consuming it can be to find a symbol in symbols-a4.pdf that you just can’t memorize. Detexify is an attempt to simplify this search.

item.title: Unpaywall
item.description: An open database of free scholarly articles for you to legally download research papers for free.

item.title: On Being a Scientist: A Guide to Responsible Conduct in Research
item.description: A guide to responsible conduct in research.

item.title: Phylopic
item.description: Free silhouette images of animals, plants, and other life forms, available for reuse under a Public Domain or Creative Commons license.

item.title: Undraw
item.description: Open source illustrations

item.title: Unsplash
item.description: Free high resolution images.

item.description: ICONs for academia

item.title: Asciinema
item.description: Command line recording and sharing.

item.description: plotting in the terminal using plaintext

item.title: Scholarpedia
item.description: the peer-reviewed open-access encyclopedia, where knowledge is curated by communities of experts.

item.title: Colorcet
item.description: Colorcet is a collection of perceptually uniform colormaps for use with Python plotting programs like bokeh, matplotlib, holoviews, and datashader based on the set of perceptually uniform colormaps created by Peter Kovesi at the Center for Exploration Targeting.

item.title: Zenodo
item.description: Make anything citable by publishing on Zenodo and getting a DOI code.

item.title: Codingame
item.description: Coding and having fun

item.title: Quiver
item.description: Programmer’s notebook, math + Markdown, code snippet.

item.description: An awesome iTerm2 backend for Matplotlib, so you can plot directly in your terminal.

item.title: plotnine
item.description: Python visualization package that follows the grammar of graphics.

item.description: statistical data visualization in Python

item.title: D3.js
item.description: The most widely used javascript lib for visualizations in the browser.

item.title: Neurostars
item.description: StackOverflow style Q&A site for neuroinformatics.

item.title: Biostars
item.description: StackOverflow style Q&A site for bioinformatics.

item.title: Coffitivity
item.description: a rather simple but useful coffee shop noise library; premium has more three more soundtracks; elegant UI; scientific research powered

item.title: Noizio
item.description: a handy white noise tool that stays in your Mac status bar.

item.title: Noisli
item.description: free mixing of multiple tracks (which is similar to Soundrown but with much better UI). Users can save a customized setting for later use.

item.title: Rainy Mood
item.description: rainy day rainy mood, simple but with excellent white noise; a new beautiful soundtrack each day

item.title: Ten Rules Plosone
item.description: Series of quick “Ten Simple Rules” articles for research scientists to manage challenges in their careers. Number of articles are life-science specific, but rest the of articles are general enough for any researcher.

item.title: Zotero
item.description: An open source bibliography reference manager with syncing and BibTeX support.

item.title: Mendeley
item.description: A bibliography reference manager with cloud storage and BibTeX support.

item.title: Readcube/Papers
item.description: A all platform app for reference mamagement, note-taking, and more. The former Papers has been rebanded as ReadCube Papers.

item.description: OSF is a free, open platform to support your research and enable collaboration.

item.title: ORCID
item.description: A unique ID for researchers

item.title: Duecredit
item.description: duecredit is being conceived to address the problem of inadequate citation of scientific software and methods, and limited visibility of donation requests for open-source software.

item.title: Protocols Io
item.description: Create, share, and collaborate on protocals. Protocals.io is not only for biologist, it can be used for any protocals.

item.description: Web interface for browsing, search and filtering recent arxiv submissions

item.description: Paperscape is an interactive map that visualises the arXiv, an open, online repository for scientific research papers.

item.description: The reuse of significant, identical, or nearly identical portions of one’s own work without acknowledging that one is doing so or citing the original work is sometimes described as self-plagiarism.

item.description: Share your slides with others and find interesting slides.

item.description: Online Mindmap, FlowChart, MindMap, UI, UML and Network charts with Collabration in Real-time.

item.description: Plectica is helps us managing our mind. It is more flexible than mindmaps.

item.description: Overleaf and ShareLaTeX are Online LaTeX editors with collaborations, history, chat, and submission.

item.description: Online LaTeX editor

item.description: Your research assistant & lab notebook, all in one app.

item.description: Hosted directly from your GitHub repository. Just edit, push, and your changes are live. Integrated with Jekyll and turns markdown posts automatically. Jekyll is a tool for blogging.

item.title: Read the Docs
item.description: Read the Docs simplifies software documentation by automating building, versioning, and hosting of your docs for you.

item.description: The De-Jargonizer is an automated jargon identification program aimed at helping scientists and science communication trainers improve and adapt vocabulary use for a variety of audiences.

item.description: Hemingway App makes your writing bold and clear. It highlights complex sentences, point out passive voice, and suggests alternative words.

item.title: Gitbook
item.description: Online tool for personal and team knowledge management.

item.description: Sphinx is a tool for python code documentation generation. It is also a very good tool to take digital notes since it supports images, equations, tables, code blocks, etc.

item.description: Wolfram Alpha is an AI assistant that does data analysis in a smart way.

item.description: Graph.tk is a dead simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Plotly
item.description: Plotly is a set of open-source graphing libraries. Plotly is the goto library to make interactive charts in Python, R, or JavaScript.

item.title: Mathematica Online
item.description: The online version of Mathematica!

item.title: Cocalc
item.description: A toolkit for coding and writing online. The UI is a bit outdated but the services are real hardcore.

item.title: Datalore
item.description: Datalore is hosted jupyter notebook

item.title: Azure Notebooks
item.description: Azure notebooks is simply a hosted Jupyter notebook.

item.title: Kaggle
item.description: Kaggle is a competition platform that bundles online computing Jupyter notebooks and data management.

item.title: Next Journal
item.description: NextJournal is the notebook for reproducible research. NextJournal provides poly-language notebooks and beautiful UI.

item.title: Google Colab
item.description: Google Colab is an online version of Jupyter Notebook which allows us to use free computation powers from Google and storage on Google Drive. Google Colab also comes with free GPU hours.

item.title: Submit New Tools
item.description: There are two ways to submit a new tool. All submitted content will be licensed under the CC BY-SA license. Under this license, everyone, including you, can access and use the content on this website freely. Please don’t submit anything if you don’t agree with this license. On how to use the content, please refer to the About page. Using Our Form We have created a form for you to submit new tools.

item.title: Taskade
item.description: Taskade is a beautiful project management tool for both personal use and team collaborations. Taskade ships with task management and note-taking tools.

item.title: Todoist
item.description: Multi-platform tool to track and analyze tasks.

item.title: Anydo
item.description: Anydo comes with a very useful daily review and reminder. Anydo also integrates with its own utilities such as calenders.

item.title: Evernote
item.description: Not so lightweight but still very good for managing life especially since it has got a lot of integrations from a lot of other services.

item.title: Google Keep
item.description: Google Keep is light-weight. It comes with powerful search. The App ships with simple drawing and handwriting.

item.title: Microsoft To Do
item.description: Task management tool backed by Microsoft and works on most platforms.

item.title: Pomotodo
item.description: A mix of todo list and pomodoro timer, with sync across devices and weekly report.

item.title: GitHub
item.description: GitHub is the most popular platform for git with social and collaborations built-in.

item.title: Gitlab
item.description: Gitlab provides git hosting, collaborations, social, automations, and more. GitLab can be both cloud-based and self-hosted using its opensource code.
